title: Gospel of Matthew
subtitle: Walking with Jesus
summary: A 30-day journey following Jesus’ life, teachings, and fulfillment of prophecy with space to pray and respond.

days.title: Roots and arrival
days.summary: Trace Jesus’ genealogy and birth to see God’s faithfulness generation after generation.

readings.note: Matthew anchors the story in Abraham and David to show Jesus as the promised King.

prompts.question: How does Jesus’ family line reveal God’s patience with imperfect people?
Where do you see God inviting you to obey quietly like Joseph?

reflection: What part of Jesus’ origin story comforts you today?
Write a short prayer thanking God for His steady work through generations.

days.title: In the wilderness
days.summary: Sit with Jesus in the desert and watch how He answers temptation with Scripture.

readings.focus: Jesus resists temptation with the Word
readings.note: Notice how Jesus quotes Deuteronomy, rooting His answers in Israel’s history.

prompts.question: Which temptation resonates most with your current season?
What passages can you carry as answers to pressure or doubt?

reflection: How is the Spirit leading you into trust today?
Write a prayer for resilience and dependence on God’s Word.

days.title: Invitation to follow
days.summary: Watch Jesus call fishermen to become disciples and imagine His call to you.

readings.note: The kingdom announcement comes with healing and inclusion of the marginalized.

prompts.question: What would it look like to leave your nets this week?
How does Jesus’ compassion for the crowds shape your view of ministry?

reflection: Name one barrier that keeps you from responding quickly to Jesus.
Pray for a teachable spirit as you follow.

days.title: Blessed and anchored
days.summary: Listen to the Beatitudes and the call to be salt and light in a weary world.

readings.note: Jesus speaks blessing over the unlikely—poor in spirit, meek, and merciful.

prompts.question: Which Beatitude do you need to rest in today?
Where might God be asking you to preserve or brighten your environment?

reflection: How can you embody salt-and-light presence in one relationship this week?
Write a prayer inviting God’s blessing to flow through you.

days.title: Teaching with authority
days.summary: Notice Jesus’ authority as He interprets the Law and invites wholehearted righteousness.

readings.note: Jesus moves from external compliance to heart-level love.

prompts.question: Where do you sense Jesus calling you to deeper reconciliation?
What does it mean for you that Jesus fulfills the Law?

reflection: List one area where you want to practice secret faithfulness this week.
Pray for a heart shaped by Jesus’ interpretation of righteousness.
